channel.title: 华尔街日报

item.title: 你的副业是生意还是爱好？对于国税局来说，这两者之间的区别很重要，这也是这位初出茅庐的言情小说家所了解到的。
item.description:

item.title: 巴塞罗那椅伊姆斯休闲椅和长椅。经典，但过于夸张，被无情地淘汰，令人疲倦。是时候考虑一下这些设计师认可的、同样别致的替代品了。
item.description:
The Barcelona Chair. The Eames Lounge Chair and Ottoman. Classic, but overexposed, relentlessly knocked-off and just tired. It's time to consider one of these designer-approved, equally chic alternatives. https://t.co/g8XyXJVHfS https://t.co/g8XyXJVHfS

item.title: 袋子放在传送带上还是垃圾桶里？笔记本电脑在包里还是包外？机场安检为何如此令人困惑？

item.title: 发短讯并不一定要X级。与伴侣谈谈什么感觉舒服，给自己一些时间去适应。

item.title: "人们意识到，不住在洛杉矶或纽约也没关系"。亚特兰大大都会区长期以来一直是嘻哈艺术家、音乐家和职业运动员的聚集地，如今已成为电影和电视行业的圣地。
item.description:
“People realized it was OK to not live in L.A. or New York.” Long a hub for hip-hop artists, musicians and pro athletes, the Atlanta metro area has become a mecca for the film and TV industries. https://t.co/3p8bnnxWts https://t.co/3p8bnnxWts

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: 从月光酒到葡萄酒庄更年长、更富裕的人口涌入阿巴拉契亚，把一个乡村地区变成了热闹的退休天堂。
item.description:
From moonshine to wineries. An older, wealthier population is flooding into Appalachia, transforming a rustic region into a bustling retirement haven. https://t.co/bh73o0WLNJ

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: 30 岁及以下人群是美国最不幸福的年龄组，其幸福感下降的原因是他们对自己的生活感觉更糟糕了
item.description:
Those 30 and under are the U.S.’s least happy age group, a decline attributed to their feeling worse about their lives https://t.co/0JGXIpfEWY https://t.co/0JGXIpfEWY

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: "你要打败我？"美国航空公司的一项计划让消费者以购买的方式获得精英常旅客身份。迎接新的关系雷区。
item.description:
“You’re going to beat me?” An American Airlines program lets consumers buy their way to an elite frequent-flyer status. Meet the new relationship minefield. https://t.co/T6Ac0WhEw9 https://t.co/T6Ac0WhEw9

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: 治疗师在你哭泣时对你竖起的大拇指。气球打断公司董事会。这是苹果一项引发混乱的功能的一部分。
item.description:
A thumbs down from your therapist while you’re crying. Balloons interrupting a company board meeting. It's part of an Apple feature that is causing chaos. https://t.co/muTJBjcW9s https://t.co/muTJBjcW9s

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: "Girls5Eva》主演 Busy Philipps 谈及自己小时候的怪癖："我有很强的主见，很容易迷恋自己喜欢的东西，这让其他孩子感到焦虑，他们希望我像他们一样--安静、酷。
item.description:
"Girls5Eva" star Busy Philipps on embracing her weirdness as a kid: "I had strong opinions and easily became obsessed with things I liked, which caused anxiety in other kids who wanted me to be like them—quiet and cool." https://t.co/B6rJ9NDsP2 https://t.co/B6rJ9NDsP2

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: 一个多世纪以来，社会一直认为反社会病症是不可治疗和不可救赎的。经过多年的研究和深入治疗，我可以说反社会者并不 "坏"、"邪恶 "或 "疯狂"。我们的行为是为了填补空虚，帕特里克-加涅写道。
item.description:
For more than a century, society has deemed sociopathy untreatable and unredeemable. After years of study and intensive therapy, I can say that sociopaths aren’t “bad” or “evil” or “crazy.” We act out to fill a void, writes Patric Gagne. https://t.co/2AUpvkQQ68 pic.twitter.com/7031aVtHzM

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: 重大新闻：参议院批准为联邦机构提供 1.2 万亿美元资金的一揽子计划，避免政府关门

item.title: 你的结婚对象往往会改变你与金钱的关系：研究人员说，随着时间的推移，夫妻在支出、储蓄和风险方面的做法往往会越来越相似
item.description:
The person you marry will often change your relationship to money: Couples often grow more alike over time in their approach to spending, saving and risk, researchers say https://t.co/gFhNxaj6n7

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: 25 年前，《黑客帝国》想象了一个人类被科技割裂的未来。梅尔-索洛维奇克写道，它也提醒我们，反抗是可能的。
item.description:
Twenty-five years ago, "The Matrix" imagined a future where human beings are cut off from one another by technology. It also reminded us that resistance is possible, writes Meir Soloveichik. https://t.co/yXK2lTm5RC https://t.co/yXK2lTm5RC

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: "私募股权》是一本关于在残酷、高风险的顶级对冲基金世界工作的回忆录。点击此处阅读节选。
item.description:
"Private Equity" is a memoir about working in the cutthroat, high-risk world of top hedge funds. Read an excerpt here. https://t.co/C3uLH0sNwm https://t.co/C3uLH0sNwm

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: 为了了解 500 万美元在退休生活中能买到什么，我们采访了全国各地拥有这个数字储蓄的退休人员。在这里，他们畅谈了自己的财务生活以及如何花费时间和金钱。
item.description:
To find out what $5 million buys in retirement, we spoke to retirees around the country with savings in that ballpark. Here, they open up about their financial lives and how they spend their time and money. https://t.co/YzOV4FbDv9 https://t.co/YzOV4FbDv9

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: 为什么没有更多的东西像汽车一样需要召回？专栏作家乔-奎纳（Joe Queenan）提出了一些候选方案，比如外套上的故障拉链和上一部《夺宝奇兵》电影。
item.description:
Why aren’t more things subject to recalls like cars are? Columnist Joe Queenan suggests some candidates, like the faulty zipper on his jacket and that last Indiana Jones movie. https://t.co/idi4M4v0kp https://t.co/idi4M4v0kp

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: 超级名模吉赛尔-邦辰（Gisele Bündchen）几乎每天都坚持锻炼，并保持简单的饮食习惯。"她说："我的全部目标就是尽我所能活得最长，活得最好。
item.description:
Supermodel Gisele Bündchen exercises almost daily and keeps her diet simple. “My whole goal is to live the longest I can living the best life that I can,” she said. https://t.co/W2F7uKiWTK https://t.co/W2F7uKiWTK

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: 也许你很难相信，曾经的爱尔兰酒吧如今已奄奄一息。沿着爱尔兰令人惊叹的狂野大西洋路（Wild Atlantic Ways）的公路旅行，我们可以看到一些保留下来的酒吧。
item.description:
It may be hard to believe, but Irish pubs as they once were are a dying breed. This road trip along Ireland's stunning Wild Atlantic Ways offers a glimpse of some holdouts. https://t.co/9Fh4SANT0G https://t.co/9Fh4SANT0G

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: "整个后院都被毁了所有的景观都没了。"在经历了一天异常猛烈的风浪之后，佛罗里达州一对夫妇的房屋依然屹立不倒，这要归功于 30 根钢筋混凝土支柱。
item.description:
“The whole backyard is shot. All the landscaping is gone.” After a day of unusually heavy wind and waves, a Florida couple’s home is still standing, thanks to 30 concrete-and-steel pilings. https://t.co/J3uMcDl0aE https://t.co/J3uMcDl0aE

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: 要想知道哪位候选人将赢得总统大选，请使用政治分析家杰夫-格林菲尔德的预测模型：竞选中的兔八哥总能打败达菲鸭
item.description:

item.title: 我们不再像过去那样关心工作。这在很大程度上要归咎于大流行病，它削弱了工作场所对人们心理的影响。
item.description:
We don’t care nearly as much about work as we used to. Blame it largely on the pandemic, which weakened the hold the workplace held on people’s psyches. https://t.co/sGF2Trcte5 https://t.co/sGF2Trcte5

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 23, 2024

item.title: 很多漫画家都蜕变成了银幕明星，但哈特如此活跃的企业家精神和交易能力还没有先例可循

Lots of comics have morphed into screen stars, but there’s no precedent for Hart’s hyperactive level of entrepreneurism and dealmaking https://t.co/x2oayZjHy0 https://t.co/x2oayZjHy0

item.title: 大谷翔平在道奇队的首秀并不尽如人意。@JasonGay：关于这位明星球员的翻译卷入赌博的指控--以及随着各联盟继续拥抱博彩业，这意味着什么。
item.description:
This wasn’t the debut Shohei Ohtani imagined with the Dodgers. @JasonGay on the gambling allegations involving the star ballplayer’s interpreter—and what it means as leagues continue to embrace the business of betting. https://t.co/KrqfJ2fHAR https://t.co/KrqfJ2fHAR
